intro: Erythrococca poggei, commonly known as the red cocculus, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its striking red berries that persist on the plant throughout the year. The plant has simple, opposite leaves and produces small, white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
